FWS.ChooseOneOrTwoEdges: Choose one or two edges and an equal number of flaws
FWS.AddAdditionalTypeOfGangText:
You can add an additional type to a gang or expert by spending two crew upgrades.
When a cohort performs actions for which its types apply, it uses its full quality rating. Otherwise, its quality is zero. A given cohort can have up to two types. Some crew upgrades will add the “Elite” feature to a gang, which gives them +1d when they roll for a given Type.
FWS.ClassExpClue1: Every time you roll a desperate action, mark xp in that action's attribute.
FWS.ClassExpClue2: You expressed your beliefs, drives, heritage, or background.
FWS.ClassExpClue3: You struggled with issues from your vice or traumas during the session.
FWS.ClassExpClueDescription: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 xp (in your playbook or an attribute) or 2 xp if that item occurred multiple times.
FWS.CrewExpClue1: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 xp (or instead mark 2xp if that item occurred multiple times).
FWS.GangTypeRoversDescription: Sailors, carriage drivers, and deathlands scavengers.
FWS.EdgesFearsomeDescription: The cohort is terrifying in aspect and reputation.
FWS.EdgesIndependentDescription: The cohort can be trusted to make good decisions and act on their own initiative in the absence of direct orders.
FWS.EdgesLoyalDescription: The cohort can’t be bribed or turned against you.
FWS.EdgesTenaciousDescription: The cohort won’t be deterred from a task.
FWS.FlawsPrincipledDescription: The cohort has an ethic or values that it won’t betray.
FWS.FlawsSavageDescription: The cohort is excessively violent and cruel.
FWS.FlawsUnreliableDescription: The cohort isn’t always available, due to other obligations, stupefaction from their vices, etc.
FWS.FlawsWildDescription: The cohort is drunken, debauched, and loud-mouthed.
FWS.HarmImpairedDescription: The cohort operates with reduced quality (-1d).
FWS.HarmBrokenDescription: The cohort can’t do anything until they recover.
FWS.HarmDeadDescription: The cohort is destroyed. You can spend coin equal to your Tier +2 to restore it, plus two downtime activities to recruit new gang members, or hire a new expert.
FWS.RollTokenDescription: If you want to pull the numbers from a character, select their Token first.
FWS.RollPartialSuccessPositionControlled: You hesitate. Withdraw and try a different approach, or else do it with a minor consequence: a minor complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you suffer lesser harm, you end up in a risky position.
FWS.RollPartialSuccessPositionRisky: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer harm, a complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you end up in a desperate position.
FWS.RollPartialSuccessPosition: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you have reduced effect.
FWS.RollFailurePositionControlled: You falter. Press on by seizing a risky opportunity, or withdraw and try a different approach.
FWS.RollFailurePositionRisky: Things go badly. You suffer harm a complication occurs, you end up in a desperate position, you lose this opportunity.
FWS.RollFailurePositionDesperate: It’s the worst outcome. You suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you lose this opportunity for action.
FWS.Name: Name
